direction.raw_text: . BURNELL HOME.  NICOLE'S BEDROOM. -- NIGHT NICOLE is lying in her bed.  A knock at the door.  SAM enters the dark bedroom and sits on the bed beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sleeping?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicole, tomorrow Mr. Stephens wants you to make your deposition at the courthouse.  I thought I'd take you over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem...I don't know...well, distant, I guess.  Hard to talk to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We used to talk a lot, didn't we, Daddy.  About all the things you were going to do for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean I'm a wheelchair girl now. It's hard to pretend I'm a beautiful rock star.  Not like you used to tell me.  Remember, Daddy?  All the people that were going to discover me?  Where are they now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns away from NICOLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He couldn't look at me.  But I looked at him.  Right at him.  His secret was mine now.  We used to share it.  But not anymore.  Now, I owned it completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, okay.  I'll take you about nine-thirty in the morning.  That's okay with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. Silence.  SAM gets up to leave the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before, everything had been so confusing.  I never knew who was to blame.  But now I know.  He's just a thief, a sneaky thief who had robbed his daughter.  Robbed me of...whatever it was that my sister still had and I didn't.  And then the accident robbed me of my body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR -- DAY SAM and NICOLE are driving to town.  They don't exchange a word. CUT TO EXT. COMMUNITY CENTRE. -- DAY SAM is carrying NICOLE up the stairs of the community centre. There is no ramp, so the wheelchair is left at the bottom. He is having difficulty, because NICOLE is keeping her body stiff and won't hold on to him. CUT TO INT. COMMUNITY CENTRE. -- DAY NICOLE is wheeled across the floor of the community centre to a table where the depositions are being made.  MITCHELL, SCHWARTZ, and the STENOGRAPHER are waiting for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last time I was in the community hall was for the big Christmas party almost a year ago.  It hadn't changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMMUNITY CENTRE. -- DAY The deposition.  SAM watches his daughter as she speaks confidently into the microphone.  The STENOGRAPHER takes notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is answering questions from the opposing lawyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is also taking notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now on that morning, did there come a time, Nicole, when you left your parents' house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time in the morning was this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About eight-thirty in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was anyone waiting for the bus with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I was alone.  My sister Jenny was sick and stayed home that day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there anything unusual about the driver, Dolores Driscoll, or the bus that particular morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?  I mean, I don't remember a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I object to the form of that question.  Note that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was the bus on time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where did you sit that morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My usual place.  On the right side. The first seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And according to your recollection, there was nothing unusual about the drive that morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until the accident?  No. (beat) Yes, there was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worried about this new information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was when Sean Walker got on.  He was crying and didn't want to leave his mother.  Mason Ansel was sitting beside me.  I asked him to move, so I could quiet Sean down.  When the bus started up, a car came around the corner and almost hit Sean's mother.  She was okay, but it really scared Sean, because he watched it out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And was this incident caused in any way by anything the driver of the bus did? Pause.  MITCHELL is nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, she hadn't even started to move the bus.  It was the car's fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was nothing reckless in Mrs. Driscoll's behavior?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I object to that form of question. Note that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did there come a time when all the children had been picked up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember that much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I'm talking, I'm remembering more about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Note my objection.  She said, 'As I'm talking.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did there come a time when the bus turned off Staples Mill Road onto the Marlowe Road at what's called Wilmot Springs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a brown dog that ran across the road up there, right by the dump, and Dolores slowed down not to hit him, and he ran into the woods.  And then Dolores drove on and turned onto the Marlowe road, as usual.  I remember that.  I'm remembering it pretty clearly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Note that she said 'pretty clearly'. Not 'clearly'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what was the weather like at this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was snowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless the report from the National Weather Bureau for the district on January 23 goes into the record, I will object to that question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will offer that report.  Well, then, now that your memory seems to be clearing, can you tell us what else  you observed at that time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before the actual accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at her father as she responds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why were you scared?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is before the accident, Nicole. Do you understand what I'm asking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why were you scared?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dolores was driving too fast. Silence.  MITCHELL is watching his entire case crumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs.  Driscoll was driving too fast? What made you think that, Nicole?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The speedometer.  And it was downhill there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could see the speedometer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I looked.  I remember clearly now.  It seemed we were going too fast down the hill.  I was scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at MITCHELL, who stares back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How fast would you say Mrs. Driscoll was going?  To the best of your recollection?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy-two miles an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy-two miles an hour?  You're sure of this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Positive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe that the bus driven by Mrs. Driscoll was going at seventy- two miles an hour at this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you I was positive.  The speedometer was large and easy to see from where I was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON The speedometer from NICOLE'S P.O.V.  It reads fifty-one miles an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw the speedometer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you say anything to Mrs. Driscoll?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was scared.  And there wasn't time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There wasn't time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Because the bus went off the road.  And crashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I do now.  Now that I'm telling it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said, 'Now that I'm telling it'. Note that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you remember about the accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember the bus swerved, it just suddenly swerved to the right, and it hit the guardrail and the snowbank on the side of the road, and then it went over the embankment there, and everyone was screaming and everything.  And that's all.  I guess I was unconscious after that. That's all.  Then I was in the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles and makes some notes in his pad.  He talks to MITCHELL without looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any questions, Mr. Stephens?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares silently at NICOLE for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy was leaning forward in his chair, his mouth half open, as if he wanted to say something.  Like what, Daddy?  Like 'What about my money?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SAM stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Nicole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wheels herself away.  She passes MITCHELL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd make a great poker player, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wheels herself over to her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go, Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in the car in front of the community centre.  She stares at SAM as he argues with MITCHELL on the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy took a long time.  I guess he wanted to have a few words with you. He must have tried to tell you that I was lying.  Then you would tell Daddy that it didn't matter if I was lying or not, the lawsuit is dead. As NICOLE'S words are heard, her point of view of SAM and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: arguing is seen. The movement of their lips is in sync with NICOLE'S voice over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone's lawsuit is dead.  Forget it.  Tell the others to forget it. It's over.  Right now, Sam, the thing you've got to worry about is why she lied.  A kid who'd do that to her own father is not normal, Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes down the stairs and enters the car, sitting down at the driver's seat.  NICOLE stares at him as he starts the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Daddy knows who lied.  He knows who the liar is.  He knows who's normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares ahead, not knowing what to do next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope he lets us keep the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to look at NICOLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like an ice cream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIRPORT. -- MORNING MITCHELL is at the baggage section of the arrival area, waiting for his luggage. He watches PETER, the man he met in the washroom changing his daughter, playing with the little girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is full of love as he swings the little girl into the air as she laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is caught in a daydream, smiling at the happy image of father and daughter.  ALISON approaches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it was nice meeting you again, Mr. Stephens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mitchell.  It was nice to see you again, Ally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say hi to Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope she gets better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell her that.

direction.raw_text: shakes MITCHELL'S hand, and leaves.

direction.raw_text: . FAIRGROUND -- DAY SAM wheels NICOLE along a path away from the same concession stand that was seen at the beginning of the film.  NICOLE is licking an ice-cream cone.  Around them, people are setting up the bandstand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy, can we come to the fair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about Sunday night?  That's always the best time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at a team of men constructing a ride.  A school bus pulls up, and a group of children spill out.  NICOLE watches as the driver tries to form them into a group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to happen to Dolores?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will the police do anything to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too late for that.  She can't drive the bus anymore.  The school board saw to that right off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll move away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's talk of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someplace where no one knows her. (beat) Someplace strange and new.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is frozen.  NICOLE smiles to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIRPORT. -- MORNING At the airport, in the arrivals bay, MITCHELL waits for his limousine. Across the road, a hotel minibus is parked.  The driver is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  The camera settles on her face as she stares at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: catches her gaze, and the two stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you see each other, almost two years later, I wonder if you realize something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: limo arrives.  He gets inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIMOUSINE -- MORNING CLOSE-UP of MITCHELL as he stares ahead, lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder if you realize that all of us - Dolores, me, the children who survived, the children who didn't - that we're all citizens of a different town now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GAS STATION -- DAY BILLY watches as a crane lifts the demolished schoolbus onto a flatbed truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A town of people living in the sweet hereafter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR -- AFTERNOON NICOLE and SAM driving home from the fairground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whether others defend us, protect us, love us or hate us - they do it to meet their own needs, not ours. The camera leaves the car to look up at the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FAIRGROUND -- DUSK Sunday night at the fairground.  NICOLE is staring at the ferris wheel.  In her imagination, the swinging cars of the slowly turning wheel are full of children.  The laughter and noise is haunting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles as she stares at this private apparition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what I learned.  This is what I found out.
direction.name: direction
